result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick L Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick L Williams not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Derrick L Williams.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 14 pages) commencing 09-09- 2022 by Kristin Menzia.

Defendant Derrick L Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Derrick L Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior felony conviction in Illinois. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD N. Romo. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court by video, defendant Derrick L Williams not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is unavailable due to a medical appointment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick L Williams in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; not served. Defense objects to an adjournment; moves to dismiss. Motion of defense is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrick L Williams in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a indigency hearing.  However, attorney Stephen Sargent appeared as counsel.  Indigency hearing NOT held.

Defendant Derrick L Williams in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by the state argued and denied by the Court.  Court scheduled a preliminary hearing in preliminary court.  Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Attorney Stephen Sargent

Defendant Derrick L Williams in court, appear by person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick L Williams in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a bail/bond hearing.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant informed the Court that his financial circumstances have changed.  Court ordered defendant to call the Public Defender's Office.  Case passed.

...
Case recalled, same appearance.  
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.  Court rescheduled matter for bail/bond hearing and status of counsel.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick L Williams not in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in Court for a bail/bond hearing.  Defendant does not appear and is NOT eligible for SPD appointment.  Court rescheduled matter.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Notice of State's Objection to Bail Set in ICCR and Request for Immediate Relief.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derrick L Williams in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Derrick L Williams in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick L Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
